intro: Euphrasia nemorosa var. tetraquetra, commonly known as the four-lobed eyebright, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers with four distinct lobes. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. This variety is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye-health benefits.
